text.p: These are the leading stories in the Lebanese press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Crackdown on dissent ordered by cabinet.
- Journalist released by Israel tells of his nightmare visit in middle of night.
- Five killed in UNIFIL helicopter crash in south Lebanon.
- Lobbyists launch new petition for municipal elections.
- The government declares war on civil disobedience.
Former Hizbollah leader Sheikh Sobhi Tufaili has launched a "hunger revolt" in the form of a civil disobedience campaign to pressure the government into easing poverty.
- Thirty Katyusha rockets fired on Israel.
- Five United Nations peacekeepers killed in helicopter crash in south Lebanon.
- U.S. secretary of state to visit Middle East at the end of the month.
